snippet: ­A new study suggests a vaccine against leishmaniasis that worked well in monkeys may have potential to work in humans as well.
abstract: National Institutes of Health study published in journal Science Translational Medicine shows vaccine against parasitical disease leishmaniasis based on saliva of sand flies has worked well in monkeys and may work in humans.
lead_paragraph: ­A new study suggests a vaccine against leishmaniasis that worked well in monkeys may have potential to work in humans as well.

headline.print_headline: Sand Fly Saliva Proves a Good Monkey Vaccine
headline.main: Sand Fly Saliva Proves a Good Monkey Vaccine for Leishmaniasis
